metadata.title: CVE-2021-34552 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - low
metadata.description:
Pillow through 8.2.0 and PIL (aka Python Imaging Library) through 1.1.7allow an attacker to pass controlled parameters directly into a convertfunction to trigger a buffer overflow in Convert.c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-34552` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

python3-pil - 7.0.0-4ubuntu0.5
python3-pil.imagetk - 7.0.0-4ubuntu0.5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: pillow package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7.0.0-4ubuntu0.5').
pillow-python2 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
